Unaddressed comments
Can we make this matcher more specific?  We'd probably use something like arg0namespace=xyz.openbmc_project.Software.  Ignoring messages in code is an anti pattern.

Thanks.
I'll take look.

Based on my further investigation and experiment, it seems not the case with arg0namespace or other filtering like 'arg0path' etc.

The code is parsing the body of the logging message and check whether it is Software error message or not.

```
    fwUpdateErrorMatcher = std::make_unique<sdbusplus::bus::match_t>(
        *crow::connections::systemBus,
        "interface='org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager',type='signal',"
        "member='InterfacesAdded',"
        "path='/xyz/openbmc_project/logging'",
        [asyncResp, url](sdbusplus::message_t& m) {
....

        for (const std::pair<std::string, dbus::utility::DBusPropertiesMap>&
                 interface : interfacesProperties)
        {
            BMCWEB_LOG_DEBUG << "TEST: interface.first = " << interface.first;
            if (interface.first == "xyz.openbmc_project.Logging.Entry")
            {
                for (const std::pair<std::string,
                                     dbus::utility::DbusVariantType>& value :
                     interface.second)
                     ...
                     const std::string* type =
                        std::get_if<std::string>(&value.second);
```



obj path = /xyz/openbmc_project/logging/entry/33
   interface.first = xyz.openbmc_project.Logging.Entry
   ...
   value.first=Message
   value.second = <error-types>  <== *type

For example, the valid/expected ones may be
xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.UnTarFailure
xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.ImageFailure
xyz.openbmc_project.Software.*

However, if we see like this, we want to ignore.
      value.second = xyz.openbmc_project.Host.Error.Event
      
      
This can happen by PLDM - https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/82257922c1442d3bee1a3d2a42885c7e1d5908e3/oem/ibm/libpldmresponder/file_io_type_pel.cpp#L268


How can we filter out those cases -- handle only the error messages which are related to xyz.openbmc_project.Software.* ?
Okay, so becaus the "Message" property is the one with the xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.*,  arg0namespace doesn't work?
Right, arg0namespace is not working for the property of the content of the msg fields.
I've checked & handled all Image & Software defined errors.
common error.  Please don't use starts_with for this kind of check.
Ack
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-bmc-code-mgmt/blob/master/xyz/openbmc_project/Software/Image.errors.yaml is the 2nd place

Ok, I think we can do to catch/handle all expected errors, but ignore the other cases.

They seem:

```

"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.UnTarFailure",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.ManifestFileFailure",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.InternalFailure",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.ImageFailure",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Image.Error.BusyFailure",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version.Error.Incompatible",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version.Error.AlreadyExists",
```

There seem extended errors - https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-logging/blob/master/extensions/openpower-pels/registry/message_registry.json and
https://github.com/ibm-openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/1050/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Software/Version.errors.yaml

```
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version.Error.ExpiredAccessKey",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version.Error.InvalidSignature",
"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version.Error.HostFile",
```
If I
Changed the code so that all Image.Errors & Version.Errors are handled, but the other non-update-related events are ignored.
This few lines of code has pushed this lambda longer than any lambda should be.  Please roll it out into a method.
I think we may need to refactor this part of the code first and then fix the issue.
Sure, I am fine with doing the refactor first
I've done the limited code-refactoring around area via https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/66086 first.
Can this just be return, and avoid the extra variable altogether?

It is to check whether `fwAvailableTimer` is to reset or not.
I've modified the code to avoid the variable - in the patchset 4.

Sorry, I misunderstood your suggestion.
I've redone so that the logic will return if it is unrelated.  The error part to clear the timer is the next statement without using another variable.
Can you link the file you got these errors from?
I add the link to the commit message.

I am looking for these links 
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Software/Version.errors.yaml

and

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-bmc-code-mgmt/blob/master/xyz/openbmc_project/Software/Image.errors.yaml
I added those links as the valid update related errors.
These appear to come from PDI and this commit is just mapping more of them. Seems reasonable
Ack
Makes sense to only return Internal Error if there was a Software Internal Error logged, instead of an error from other application.
